thread.section_title: Arts and Entertainment coverage for all ages and interests - San Francisco Chronicle
thread.title: MoAD celebrates its 10th anniversary, survival and growth
thread.title_full: MoAD celebrates its 10th anniversary, survival and growth - San Francisco Chronicle

author: Leah Garchik
title: MoAD celebrates its 10th anniversary, survival and growth
text:
Vivian Rahwanji at MoAD reception Vivian Rahwanji at MoAD reception
The 10th anniversary of the Museum of the African Diaspora was celebrated with a cheer and an I-will-survive “whew!” at a “Finding the I in Diaspora” gala Saturday night at the museum and the St. Regis Hotel. Ten’s a round number, but the peppy mood of the event reflected another number: MoAD 2.0 is museum director Linda Harrison ’s ongoing re-energizing of the institution with provocative exhibits, a focus on youngsters and affiliation with the Smithsonian Institution. Vivian Rahwanji at MoAD reception Vivian Rahwanji at MoAD reception
